title: General
text: The amount of credit which would (but for this subsection and subsection(c)) be allowed with respect to any facility for any taxable year shall not exceed the amount which bears the same ratio to such amount of credit as——the national megawatt capacity limitation allocated to the facility, bears to—the total megawatt nameplate capacity of such facility.

title: Of National Limitation
text: The aggregate amount of national megawatt capacity limitation allocated by the Secretary under paragraph(3)shall not exceed 6,000 megawatts.

title: Of Limitation
text: The Secretary shall allocate the national megawatt capacity limitation in such manner as the Secretary may prescribe.

logical_structure.result: The Secretary shall allocate the national megawatt capacity limitation in such manner as the Secretary may prescribe.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45J(b)(3)Allocation Of Limitation—The  Secretary shall allocate the national  megawatt capacity limitation in  such
                     manner as the Secretary may prescribe.

text: Not later than 6 months after the date of the enactment of or any amendment to this section, the Secretary shall prescribe such regulations as may be necessary or appropriate to carry out the purposes of this subsection. Such regulations shall provide a certification process under which the Secretary, after consultation with the Secretary of Energy, shall approve and allocate the national megawatt capacity limitation.

Such regulations shall provide a certification process under which the Secretary, after consultation with the Secretary of Energy, shall approve and allocate the national megawatt capacity limitation.

title: General
text: Any unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation shall be allocated by the Secretary under paragraph (3) as rapidly as is practicable after December 31, 2020——first to facilities placed in service on or before such date to the extent that such facilities did not receive an allocation equal to their full nameplate capacity, and—then to facilities placed in service after such date in the order in which such facilities are placed in service.

logical_structure.result: Any unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation shall be allocated by the Secretary under paragraph (3) as rapidly as is practicable after December 31, 2020——first to facilities placed in service on or before such date to the extent that such facilities did not receive an allocation equal to their full nameplate capacity, and—then to facilities placed in service after such date in the order in which such facilities are placed in service.

                           facilities did not receive an allocation equal to their full nameplate capacity, andI.R.C. § 45J(b)(5)(A)(ii)—then to facilities placed in service after such date in the order in which such facilities
                           are placed in service.

text: the aggregate amount of national megawatt capacity limitation allocated by the Secretary before January 1, 2021, reduced by any amount of such limitation which was allocated to a facility which was not placed in service before such date.

title: With Other Provisions
text: In the case of any unutilized national megawatt capacity limitation allocated by the Secretary pursuant to this paragraph——such allocation shall be treated for purposes of this section in the same manner as an allocation of national megawatt capacity limitation, and—subsection (d)(1)(B) shall not apply to any facility which receives such allocation.

                           an allocation of national megawatt capacity limitation, andI.R.C. § 45J(b)(5)(C)(ii)—subsection (d)(1)(B) shall not apply to any facility which receives such allocation.

title: Limitation
text: The amount of the credit allowable under subsection(a)(after the application of subsection(b)) for any taxable year with respect to any facility shall not exceed an amount which bears the same ratio to $125,000,000 as——the national megawatt capacity limitation allocated under subsection(b)to the facility, bears to—1,000.

                        the facility, bears toI.R.C. § 45J(c)(1)(B)—1,000.

title: General
text: The amount of the credit determined under subsection(a)shall be reduced by an amount which bears the same ratio to the amount of the credit (determined without regard to this paragraph) as——the amount by which the reference price (as defined in section45(e)(2)(C)) for the calendar year in which the sale occurs exceeds 8 cents, bears to—3 cents.

logical_structure.result: The amount of the credit determined under subsection(a)shall be reduced by an amount which bears the same ratio to the amount of the credit (determined without regard to this paragraph) as——the amount by which the reference price (as defined in section45(e)(2)(C)) for the calendar year in which the sale occurs exceeds 8 cents, bears to—3 cents.

                        (determined without regard to this paragraph) as—I.R.C. § 45J(c)(2)(A)(i)—the  amount by which the reference price (as defined in section45(e)(2)(C))
                           for the calendar year in which the sale occurs exceeds 8 cents, bears toI.R.C. § 45J(c)(2)(A)(ii)—3  cents.

title: Adjustment Based On Inflation
text: The 8 cent amount in subparagraph(A)shall be adjusted by multiplying such amount by the inflation adjustment factor (as defined in section45(e)(2)(B)) for the calendar year in which the sale occurs. If any amount as increased under the preceding sentence is not a multiple of 0.1 cent, such amount shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of 0.1 cent.
conditions: any amount as increased under the preceding sentence is not a multiple of 0.1 cent, such amount shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of 0.1 cent.

if: any amount as increased under the preceding sentence is not a multiple of 0.1 cent, such amount shall be rounded to the nearest multiple of 0.1 cent.

I.R.C. § 45J(c)(2)(B)Phaseout Adjustment Based On Inflation—The  8 cent amount in  subparagraph(A)shall be adjusted by multiplying  such amount by the inflation adjustment factor
                        (as defined in  section45(e)(2)(B))
                        for the calendar year in which the sale  occurs. If any amount as increased under
                        the preceding sentence is  not a multiple of 0.1 cent, such amount shall be rounded
                        to the  nearest multiple of 0.1 cent.

title: General
text: The term “advanced nuclear power facility” means any advanced nuclear facility——which is owned by the taxpayer and which uses nuclear energy to produce electricity, and—which is placed in service after the date of the enactment of this paragraph and before January 1, 2021.

logical_structure.result: The term “advanced nuclear power facility” means any advanced nuclear facility——which is owned by the taxpayer and which uses nuclear energy to produce electricity, and—which is placed in service after the date of the enactment of this paragraph and before January 1, 2021.

                        andI.R.C. § 45J(d)(1)(B)—which is placed in service after the date of the enactment  of this  paragraph and
                        before January 1, 2021.

requirements: any advanced nuclear facility——which is owned by the taxpayer and which uses nuclear energy to produce electricity, and—which is placed in service after the date of the enactment of this paragraph and before January 1, 2021.

title: Nuclear Facility
text: For purposes of paragraph (1), the term “advanced nuclear facility” means any nuclear facility the reactor design for which is approved after December 31, 1993, by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (and such design or a substantially similar design of comparable capacity was not approved on or before such date).

logical_structure.result: For purposes of paragraph (1), the term “advanced nuclear facility” means any nuclear facility the reactor design for which is approved after December 31, 1993, by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (and such design or a substantially similar design of comparable capacity was not approved on or before such date).

                     (and such design  or a substantially similar design of comparable capacity was  not

title: General
text: If, with respect to a credit under subsection (a) for any taxable year——a qualified public entity would be the taxpayer (but for this paragraph), and—such entity elects the application of this paragraph for such taxable year with respect to all (or any portion specified in such election) of such credit, the eligible project partner specified in such election, and not the qualified public entity, shall be treated as the taxpayer for purposes of this title with respect to such credit (or such portion thereof).

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45J(e)(1)In General—If, with respect to a credit under subsection (a) for any taxable year—I.R.C. § 45J(e)(1)(A)—a qualified public entity would be the taxpayer (but for this paragraph), andI.R.C. § 45J(e)(1)(B)—such entity elects the application of this paragraph for such taxable year with respect
                        to all (or any portion specified in such election) of such credit, the eligible project
                        partner specified in such election, and not the qualified public entity, shall be
                        treated as the taxpayer for purposes of this title with respect to such credit (or
                        such portion thereof).

title: Public Entity
text: The term “qualified public entity” means——a Federal, State, or local government entity, or any political subdivision, agency, or instrumentality thereof,—a mutual or cooperative electric company described in section501(c)(12)or1381(a)(2), or—a not-for-profit electric utility which had or has received a loan or loan guarantee under the Rural Electrification Act of 1936.

logical_structure.result: The term “qualified public entity” means——a Federal, State, or local government entity, or any political subdivision, agency, or instrumentality thereof,—a mutual or cooperative electric company described in section501(c)(12)or1381(a)(2), or—a not-for-profit electric utility which had or has received a loan or loan guarantee under the Rural Electrification Act of 1936.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45J(e)(2)(A)Qualified Public Entity—The term “qualified public entity” means—I.R.C. § 45J(e)(2)(A)(i)—a Federal, State, or local government entity, or any political subdivision, agency,
                           or instrumentality thereof,I.R.C. § 45J(e)(2)(A)(ii)—a mutual or cooperative electric company described in section501(c)(12)or1381(a)(2), orI.R.C. § 45J(e)(2)(A)(iii)—a not-for-profit electric utility which had or has received a loan or loan guarantee
                           under the Rural Electrification Act of 1936.

title: Project Partner
text: The term “eligible project partner” means any person who——is responsible for, or participates in, the design or construction of the advanced nuclear power facility to which the credit under subsection (a) relates,—participates in the provision of the nuclear steam supply system to such facility,—participates in the provision of nuclear fuel to such facility,—is a financial institution providing financing for the construction or operation of such facility, or—has an ownership interest in such facility.

logical_structure.result: The term “eligible project partner” means any person who——is responsible for, or participates in, the design or construction of the advanced nuclear power facility to which the credit under subsection (a) relates,—participates in the provision of the nuclear steam supply system to such facility,—participates in the provision of nuclear fuel to such facility,—is a financial institution providing financing for the construction or operation of such facility, or—has an ownership interest in such facility.

                           nuclear power facility to which the credit under subsection (a) relates,I.R.C. § 45J(e)(2)(B)(ii)—participates in the provision of the nuclear steam supply system to such facility,I.R.C. § 45J(e)(2)(B)(iii)—participates in the provision of nuclear fuel to such facility,I.R.C. § 45J(e)(2)(B)(iv)—is a financial institution providing financing for the construction or operation of
                           such facility, orI.R.C. § 45J(e)(2)(B)(v)—has an ownership interest in such facility.

title: To Partnerships
text: In the case of a credit under subsection (a) which is determined at the partnership level——for purposes of paragraph (1)(A), a qualified public entity shall be treated as the taxpayer with respect to such entity's distributive share of such credit, and—the term “eligible project partner” shall include any partner of the partnership.

logical_structure.result: In the case of a credit under subsection (a) which is determined at the partnership level——for purposes of paragraph (1)(A), a qualified public entity shall be treated as the taxpayer with respect to such entity's distributive share of such credit, and—the term “eligible project partner” shall include any partner of the partnership.

raw_text:
I.R.C. § 45J(e)(3)(A)Application To Partnerships—In the case of a credit under subsection (a) which is determined at the partnership
                        level—I.R.C. § 45J(e)(3)(A)(i)—for purposes of paragraph (1)(A), a qualified public entity shall be treated as the
                           taxpayer with respect to such entity's distributive share of such credit, andI.R.C. § 45J(e)(3)(A)(ii)—the term “eligible project partner”
                           shall include any partner of the partnership.

title: Year In Which Credit Taken Into Account
text: In the case of any credit (or portion thereof) with respect to which an election is made under paragraph (1), such credit shall be taken into account in the first taxable year of the eligible project partner ending with, or after, the qualified public entity's taxable year with respect to which the credit was determined.

logical_structure.result: In the case of any credit (or portion thereof) with respect to which an election is made under paragraph (1), such credit shall be taken into account in the first taxable year of the eligible project partner ending with, or after, the qualified public entity's taxable year with respect to which the credit was determined.

                        made under paragraph (1), such credit shall be taken into account in the first taxable
                        year of the eligible project partner ending with, or after, the qualified public entity's
                        taxable year with respect to which the credit was determined.

title: Of Transfer Under Private Use Rules
text: For purposes of section141(b)(1), any benefit derived by an eligible project partner in connection with an election under this subsection shall not be taken into account as a private business use.

logical_structure.result: For purposes of section141(b)(1), any benefit derived by an eligible project partner in connection with an election under this subsection shall not be taken into account as a private business use.

                        under this subsection shall not be taken into account as a private business use.

title: Rules To Apply
text: Rules similar to the rules of paragraphs(1),(3),(4), and(5)of section45(e)shall apply for purposes of this section.

logical_structure.result: Rules similar to the rules of paragraphs(1),(3),(4), and(5)of section45(e)shall apply for purposes of this section.
